channel.title: Reading policy | Estadística para Química Analítica

item.title: Loading Data from Excel, data.frames, and ggplot2
item.description:
Suggested Readings

Nick Tierney’s RMarkdown for Scientists is an excellent resource for understanding RMarkdown. We’ll be drawing on it for more classes.

For right now, I’d like you to look over the Workflow section:

https://rmd4sci.njtierney.com/workflow.html

And the Using RMarkdown section:

https://rmd4sci.njtierney.com/using-rmarkdown.html

Practice your ggplot2 skills

After this lecture, you now know enough to get started in the interactive R-Bootcamp. You can start with chapter 1:

https://r-bootcamp.netlify.com/chapter1

item.title: Introduction to R/RStudio
item.description:
Required

  • R and RStudio Basics - make sure to watch the videos.

Practice

  • In the Part 1 RStudio project, there is a document called “Practicing with Swirl” which will point you to how to run an interactive tutorial in RStudio to reinforce concepts in the lab.
